[[File:Oscar Morland 9 May 1967.jpg: On [[9 May]] [[1967]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"
thumb]]: a letter]] to Oscar Morland'''.<ref name=C>{{CG
column6: articlename=Item 699 - J. R. R. Tolkien Catalog 240 (Aug 2000)

[[File:Oscar Morland 9 May 1967.jpg: *'''Subject:''' Tolkien thanks Morland for sending him copies his privately compiled [[The Lord of the Rings Index
thumb]]: indexes for]] ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.

[[File:Oscar Morland 9 May 1967.jpg: *'''Description:''' Typed letter with signature, one page, 6.75 x 8.75, 76 Sandfield Road, Oxford letterhead.
*'''Publication:''' A description of the letter was published in [[The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide
thumb]]: ''The J.R.R. Tolkien Companion and Guide: Chronology'']] (p. 698).

[[File:Oscar Morland 9 May 1967.jpg: Thank you very much for the typed copies of your indexes. I think it is a very generous gift. It will probably be of considerable use to me when I have time to turn to the correction and improvement of the index provided in the revised edition of ''The Lord of the Rings'' published last year. It is the only index material I have received that takes in the Appendices, and these references will save me a lot of time. Thank you also for telling me of the pleasure you and your family have found in my works.
